posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked:
Because at 9106 we have both XRPs and Romis, and we switched to python this year, we’re interested in having a very similar development environment for our students that use our XRPs and Romis.

There’s  a good description of a valid set of instruction to get 2024 robotpy working with the XRP here: Using RobotPy with XRP .

It seems that the path to use 2024 robotpy working with the Romi is broken.

Looking here: Releases · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub

GitHub - wpilibsuite/WPILibPi at v2024.1.1-beta-1 - WPILib 2024.3.1 and RobotPy 2024.3.1 are supported, but not Romi.

GitHub - wpilibsuite/WPILibPi at v2023.2.1 - WPILib 2023.4.1 and RobotPy 2023.4.1 are supported with Romi.

From RobotPy 2023 to RobotPy 2024 there was a significant switch to pyproject.toml to install modules.  Our preference would be to not teach our students both 2023 and 2024 RobotPy semantics.

Might there be an experimental branch somewhere where I could try out and or debug RobotPy 2024 with a Romi?

Or, am I assuming incorrectly that we can’t put RobotPy 2024 on a PC with RobotPy 2023 in a Romi?

Thanks for all of the awesome work in this area!

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You can use a 2024 desktop version of WPILib/RobotPy with a 2023 Romi Pi image. With Romi, the code is always running on the PC side, not on the Pi, and the WS protocol should not have broken between the two.

posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked: Thanks! I’ll give that a try!

posts.name: Mike Stitt
Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: You need robotpy-halsim-ws installed. Probably should make it a dependency of robotpy-romi.

posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked:
Thanks!

Installing this image on the raspberry pi sdcard:

https://github.com/wpilibsuite/WPILibPi/releases/download/v2023.2.1/WPILibPi_64_image-v2023.2.1-Romi.zip

Start with this directory tree: examples/RomiReference at main · robotpy/examples · GitHub

add a pyproject.toml to the RomiReference directory

And then from the RomiReference directory:

Did the trick.

posts.name: Mike Stitt
posts.cooked: This code base is archived here: GitHub - spiresfrc9106/romiReferencePython: The RobotPy Examples RomiReference adjusted so that it runs on RobotPy 2024
